meta.name: generator
meta.content: HTML Tidy for Windows (vers 25 March 2009), see www.w3.org

div.p: Plugin Version 1.0.0.021
Arynga’s AppDynamics is an intelligent platform for remote software, firmware, and data management for connected vehicles.
More information can be found at Arynga website.
EC-AppDynamics calls the RESTful AppDynamics web service using HTTP Requests and passes the user-provided parameters. Only essential parameters are required to work with AppDynamics service.
The ElectricFlow plugin for Arynga’s AppDynamics supports:

ul.li: various REST-messages to work with AppDynamics service

div.p: This plugin was developed and tested against:
This message is used to activate particular group. Please note that in the system can be only one active group with particular release package UUID.

p.strong: Activate new version of Update File

div.p: This message is used to finalize adding new version of UF.

This message is used to define new group that is used to collect vehicles into one logical group. By
default newly created group is inactive - user has to explicitly activate it. Release packages shall be
created before this request is issued.
This message is used to define new vehicle in the AppDynamics system.

p.strong: Add new version to Release Package

div.p: This message is used to create new version of Release Package. Update Files versions (at elast one version of one Update File) shoud be added to new version of Release Package. If Update Files versions was added correctly, Release Package version could be activated. Update cannot ommit versions with freeze flag set to “yes”, even if there is newer version of RP.

p.strong: Add new version to Update File

div.p: This message is used to create new version of Release Package. Update Files versions (at elast one version of one Update File) shoud be added to new version of Release Package. If Update Files versions was added correctly, Release Package version could be activated. Update cannot ommit versions with freeze flag set to “yes”, even if there is newer version of RP.

p.strong: Assign UF to new version of Release Package

div.p: This message is used to assign particular UF to version.

p.strong: Check if RP is in a group

div.p: This message is used to check if Release Package is in a group
This message is used to create new manufacturer. Manufacturer name shall be unique.
This message is used to create new Release Package container.
This message is used to define new update file object. When it is created, user can add versions of such UF.

p.strong: Finalize adding new version to Release Package

div.p:
This message is used to finalize adding new version to RP. After this request new version is added to
RP.
This message is used to verify if server is running correctly.
This message is used to query group info
This message is used to update file information

p.strong: Send image of the Update File via SCP

div.p: This is to copy the update file to target host
This is to copy the update file to target host

Usage example
curl -i -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X POST -d
'{"protocol":"1.7", "id": null, "session": "8GURNpDkLFFuF3nzLPZvTbm30lG", "type":"Ping",
"data": null, "seq": 1}' http://148.251.87.173:18601
To check if AppDynamics server up and running correctly you could run ‘Ping’ procedure
For detailed explanation please refer to AppDynamics API documentation.
